list.title: 192 Books
list.description: Book store with a mix of art and literature. The staff are very helpful at giving recommendations.

list.title: ABC Carpet & Home
list.description: Multiple stories of home furnishings, rugs, jewelry, clothing, and gifts. ABC create beautiful displays and source their selection from a mix of independent designers like Aviva Stanoff, wwake, and Tata Harper. With a focus on fair labor standards and sustainability, each item is a 'forever' piece.

list.title: Adaptations
list.description: High quality curation of vintage furniture and knick knacks. Find everything from mid-century modern wood pieces to beautiful pastel selections. The store also carries new items, such as throw pillows, by specialty designers.

list.title: Aedes Perfumery
list.description: One of the go-to destinations for those obsessed with fragrances. The selections are well above any department store and they stock harder to find brands in candles and perfumes.

list.title: Albertine
list.description: Stunning French bookstore with winding staircase and constellation ceiling (which is enough reason to visit). Features an area to sit down and browse through the books before you purchase.

list.title: Alo Yoga
list.description: Activewear brand known for their yoga pants. The materials are soft to keep you comfortable in a yoga class.

list.title: Amarcord
list.description: More is more at this go-to for sixties and seventies vintage dresses. You'll find pussy-bow dresses, maxi skirts, and suede jackets. If you're looking for patterns, this is your place.

list.title: Anna Sui
list.description: Lustrous metallic, maximalist prints, and touches of lace make Anna Sui's clothing stand out from the pack. Take a look at her catwalks to get inspiration on how to wear them.

list.title: Thriftwares
list.description: Thriftwares is at both the Williamsburg and SoHo location of Artists and Fleas. Come on the right day and you'll find eye-catching vintage items.

list.title: Azaleas
list.description: Lingerie and swimwear store carrying labels such as Araks, Fleur Du Mal, Mara Hoffman, Lisa Marie Fernandez, and Skin. The store is arranged by color and the staff are excellent at helping you navigate your way through their selection and sizing.

list.title: Barneys
list.description: The flagship on Madison Ave is a fashion-lovers destination.  Also check out Barneys Downtown on Seventh Ave for a more select range of cutting edge fashion.

list.title: Beacon's Closet
list.description: Beacon's comes with a huge caveat, sometimes you will spend an hour searching only to come out empty handed, but if you have the time and patience, it will frequently pay off.

list.title: Bird
list.description: Boutique with designers including Dries van Noten, Ulla Johnson, Rachel Antonoff, and Jesse Kamm. Each store carries a thoughtful selection of emerging and independent designers.

list.title: Bond No. 9
list.description: New York-based perfumery selling a wide range of city-themed scents in bright, recognizable bottles.

list.title: Bonnie Slotnick Cookbooks
list.description: Cookbook store containing both rare and current must-haves. If you can't find what you're looking for Bonnie will help you track it down.

list.title: Bookmarc
list.description: Fashion and art bookstore perfect for picking up a gift or finding a new coffee table book for your home.

list.title: Books Are Magic
list.description: Author Emma Straub's bookstore where a community of book-lovers come to discover new authors and hear readings. There's a large children's selection too.

list.title: Brookfield Place
list.description: Battery Park City mall with a Saks, Gucci, and one of the best Equinox locations in New York. Also in the complex area is a great multiplex theater: Regal Battery Park Stadium 11.

list.title: Brooklyn Herborium
list.description: Spa and beauty store selling all-natural products handmade in Brooklyn of top quality ingredients. Services include facials and eye treatments.

list.title: C.O. Bigelow Apothecaries
list.street address: 414 Ave of the Americas, New York, NY 10011
list.description: Apothecary/pharmacy founded in 1838 with line of products and a selection of upscale beauty brands.

list.title: CAP Beauty
list.description: Cult beauty store selling all-natural makeup, skincare, and wellness products. The spa offers a range of different facials and acupuncture. No tipping policy.

list.title: Catbird
list.description: Jewelry boutique specializing in delicate jewelry and stackable rings made in their Williamsburg studio using recycled or fair-trade gold. Catbird also carry lines from designers like Sofia Zakia, Kataoka, Elisa Solomon, and Jennie Kwon.

list.title: Century 21
list.description: Head straight up to the third level for a selection of discounted designer clothing. The racks are messy and the space is busy but if you persevere you will likely find something worth your troubles.

list.title: City Opera Thrift Shop
list.description: Double story thrift store with many quality pieces to be found. Proceeds go to the New York City Opera.

list.title: Consignment Brooklyn
list.description: Consignment store with a large selection of clothing labels including local New York designers.

list.title: Derek Lam
list.description: Womenswear that balances feminine and masculine elements to create unique details on classic silhouettes.

list.title: Dover Street Market
list.description: Avant-garde boutique in interesting multi-level store. Designers carried include Cecilie Bahnsen, The Vampire's Wife, Molly Goddard, and Ellery.

list.title: Duo
list.description: Quality over quantity at this East Village boutique. The minimalist style of the jewelry and clothing is seen in both the new and vintage pieces.

list.title: Edith Machinist
list.description: If vintage handbags and shoes are your thing, Edith Machinist has you covered. The store is well curated and competitively priced. Clothing is sorted by color while shoes are ordered by size, making the shopping process much easier.

list.title: Erica Weiner
list.description: Searching for jewelry can be tiresome because many stores have a small selection but Erica Weiner carries antique finds along with their own. Each piece feels special.

list.title: Erie Basin
list.description: Design-focused antiques dealer in Red Hook. Keep up with their Instagram account to see what they have in store.

list.title: Fivestory
list.description: Set in a beautiful townhouse on the Upper East Side stocking a large selection of cult status designers.

list.title: Fleur Du Mal
list.description: Beautiful collection of lingerie, clothing, and swimwear. You'll find many silks and lace.

list.title: Flying Solo
list.description: Fashion collective made up of local and independent designers. You'll be sure to find something unique.

list.title: Fox & Fawn
list.description: Greenpoint clothing consignment store with racks ordered by color. Competitive prices for both buying and selling.

list.title: Frame
list.description: Known for their perfect-fit denim but don't stop there — their clothes embody a laidback French aesthetic.

list.title: Glossier
list.description: Showroom for makeup giant Glossier. The always busy store does a good job of making the shopping experience efficient.

list.title: Gucci
list.description: Multi-level flagship store with whimsical mannequins, bold patterns, and lavish décor. Check out their bookstore at the Wooster St. location.

list.title: Hatch
list.description: Stylish maternity wear designed in response to the often unflattering and outdated options of others.

list.title: Horizons
list.description: New and used vintage clothing and jewelry. The chic selection features natural materials and earth tone fabrics.

list.title: Housing Works Thrift Shop
list.description: This Housing Works location has great designer pieces you can find if you have a little patience. The clothes are set out neatly which makes the hunt a little easier.

list.title: Intermix
list.description: Each Intermix location carries slightly different stock and the Soho store is often our top pick!

list.title: Isabel Marant
list.description: French clothing essentials that are versatile enough you can wear on the weekend, to an event, or even to work.

list.title: Kirna Zabete
list.description: Boutique department store stocking designers such as Alessandra Rich, Rosie Assoulin, and Saloni.

list.title: Kith
list.description: Popular streetwear store known for interesting collaborations and gearing the market towards women too.

list.title: La Garconne
list.description: La Garçonne opened its first brick and mortar location in Tribeca and the name of the store says it all: the clothing is a mix of feminine and masculine.

list.title: Le Grand Strip
list.description: Fun and fabulous vintage clothing in Williamsburg with reasonable prices.

list.title: Le Labo
list.description: Perfumery with unusual scents including Thé Noir, which we discovered from the beautiful smell in The Edition Hotels.

list.title: Love Adorned
list.description: Beautifully curated selection of vintage and independently-designed jewelry in a large space.

list.title: Madame Matovu
list.description: Tiny vintage clothing store in the West Village carrying bold and sparkly finds.

list.title: Malin Landaeus
list.description: Vintage clothing store in Williamsburg selling hand dyed silks, giving new life to the vintage pieces in pastel shades.

list.title: Mansur Gavriel
list.description: Handbags and shoes displayed in a rainbow of muted colors at this cult favorite store. The leather goods are produced in Italy.

list.title: Marlene Wetherell
list.description: Favorite vintage store tucked inside The Showplace. Marlene's fashion knowledge and enthusiasm make the experience all the more fun.

list.title: Marni
list.description: Bright and unexpected prints are a staple at this bold Italian label.

list.title: Maryam Nassir Zadeh
list.description: Retailer carrying cutting-edge designers in a well laid out space and the store's own shoe collection is always a fun time.

list.title: McNally Jackson
list.description: Nolita bookstore with a café to enjoy your new purchases. The store also specializes in literary and art periodicals.

list.title: Mirth
list.description: Minimalist vintage store where you'll find items like espadrilles, wide leg trousers, linen shirts, and silk slips.

list.title: Miu Miu
list.description: Feminine and playful aesthetic pleasing to our maximalist heart. Miu Miu's creativity never disappoints.

list.title: Moda Operandi
list.description: Moda Operandi's brick and mortar location on the Upper East Side set inside a townhouse. The showroom, like the website, is known for items that are straight off the runway. By appointment only.

list.title: Narnia
list.description: Williamsburg vintage store offering designs ranging from Navajo aesthetics to lace dresses.

list.title: New York Vintage
list.description: Vintage store selling clothing, furniture, and art. Lots of items waiting to be found!

list.title: NikeLab
list.description: Nike's innovative and bespoke offerings. Collaborations using the brightest talent.

list.title: No. 6 Store
list.street address: 8 Centre Market Pl, New York, NY 10013
list.description: Known for timeless and comfortable clogs and shearling-lined winter boots in a small Little Italy store.

list.title: Opening Ceremony
list.description: Avant-garde retailer and label located in SoHo. Store carries designers such as Alessandra Rich, Staud, and Rodarte.

list.title: Otte
list.description: New York boutique carrying designers like Rachel Comey, Saloni, and Anni Lu.

list.title: Outdoor Voices
list.description: Athleisure/yoga clothes you can wear all day. Known for their pastels and colorblocking.

list.title: Pippin Vintage Jewelry
list.description: Vintage store carrying both fine and costume jewelry to satisfy differing budgets. Be sure to open all the drawers in the store to find their full selection.

list.title: Rachel Comey
list.description: SoHo flagship in a beautiful light-filled space showcasing clothing women agree feels great to wear.

list.title: Reformation
list.description: LA label known for feminine dresses and their sustainable and ethical practices. The NoHo store utilizes technology to help you find different sizes and check out.

list.title: Repetto
list.description: Leather ballet shoes in colors of the rainbow are displayed on circular tables in this SoHo boutique.

list.title: Ritual Vintage
list.description: Vintage store specializing in historical clothing and designer items. Anyone with an interest in fashion history will love it!

list.title: Saks Fifth Avenue
list.description: Flagship of the luxury department store that is thoughtfully segmented and has friendly customer service to help with anything you are looking for.

list.title: Sandro
list.description: On-trend French label known for contrasting details and bold uses of color. Frequently discounts their whole line too!

list.title: Screaming Mimi’s
list.description: Vintage store specializing in costume. Bright colors, sequins, and embellishments galore.

list.title: Simone Rocha
list.description: Feminine floral dresses, delicate tulles, and pearls with an edge. Stop by the store and be prepared to want everything.

list.title: Smythson
list.hours: Mon, Tues, Wed, Fri, Sat: 10am-7pm | Thurs 10am-8pm | Sun: 11am-5pm
list.description: British stationary store known for their stylish planners.

list.title: Still House
list.description: Bespoke jewelry and homeware store selling independent designers. Perfect for your gift shopping!

list.title: Target
list.description: Of course Target is not a secret, but we love their homewares and children's selection and it's been so nice to have stores in Manhattan now.

list.title: The Apartment by The Line
list.description: Designed to look like a living room where everything is for sale — from art and fashion to homewares. This shopping experience is unique and intimate.

list.title: The Great Eros
list.description: Stunning lingerie and clothing store with helpful staff. Be warned that it's hard to walk out without more than you intended!

list.title: The Laundress
list.description: Eco-friendly laundry products including specialty items such as denim wash, sport spray, and a bleach alternative.

list.title: The RealReal
list.description: Amazing selection from their online consignment store, all in excellent condition. Fair pricing for both buyers and sellers.

list.title: The Strand
list.description: Large selection of new, used, and rare books opened since 1927. You can spend hours in their multi-story location.

list.title: The Webster
list.description: Multi-brand boutique in a beautiful space. Carrying most sought after designer labels you could want, this is one of our favorite shopping destinations!

list.title: Three Lives & Company
list.description: Small, independent bookstore located in the West Village with very helpful staff who will take time to recommend anything you are after.

list.title: Tisane Pharmacy
list.description: One-stop-shop for prescriptions, compounding pharmacy, homeopathy, skincare, and even a coffee shop.

list.title: Tom Dixon
list.description: Sophisticated homewares featuring metallic and geometric designs.

list.title: Totokaelo
list.description: Avant garde fashion boutique also carrying a selection of homewares.

list.title: Vintage Thrift East
list.description: Non-profit vintage store with a selection of homewares, books, and clothing. Always a reliable destination when doing the thrift store rounds.

list.title: Westfield World Trade Center
list.description: Mall inside the Oculus at the World Trade Center. Stores in this Westfield include Eataly, Cos, Epicure Boulud, Aesop, and Blue Bottle Coffee.

list.title: Zero + Maria Cornejo
list.description: Sculptural and elegant designs from a brand that is committed to being locally produced in New York and utilizing sustainable fabrics when possible.

list.title: Zitomer
list.description: Zitomer is much more than a pharmacy — the retro store is huge but come for the hair accessories!
